stimulusHtml: Jimmy, who was diagnosed with schizophrenia, sees images of cats everywhere even when no cats are present. What symptom is Jimmy most clearly demonstrating?
choicesHtml: Paranoia, because Jimmy thinks the cats are out to attack him.
Disorganized thinking, because seeing imaginary cats all over the place is a sign of disorganization.
Hallucinations, because Jimmyâ€™s perception is incorrect.
Delusions, because Jimmy thinks that he is a cat.
